question_name: What is the normal range of body temperature in Celsius?
subject: Medicine

options.name: 36.1 to 37.2
options.description: The normal body temperature range is typically between 36.1 and 37.2 degrees Celsius.

options.name: 35.0 to 36.0
options.description: This range is generally considered below normal.

options.name: 37.5 to 38.5
options.description: This range is typically considered above normal.

options.name: 38.0 to 39.0
options.description: This range indicates a fever.

question_name: Which vitamin is known as ascorbic acid?

options.name: Vitamin A
options.description: Vitamin A is also known as retinol.

options.name: Vitamin B12
options.description: Vitamin B12 is also known as cobalamin.

options.name: Vitamin C
options.description: Vitamin C is also known as ascorbic acid.

options.name: Vitamin D
options.description: Vitamin D is also known as calciferol.

question_name: What is the common term for myocardial infarction?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Stroke
options.description: A stroke is a cerebrovascular accident.

options.name: Heart attack
options.description: Myocardial infarction is commonly known as a heart attack.

options.name: Angina
options.description: Angina is chest pain due to reduced blood flow to the heart.

options.name: Arrhythmia
options.description: Arrhythmia is an irregular heartbeat.

question_name: Which organ is primarily affected by hepatitis?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Heart
options.description: The heart is not primarily affected by hepatitis.

options.name: Kidneys
options.description: The kidneys are not primarily affected by hepatitis.

options.name: Liver
options.description: Hepatitis primarily affects the liver.

options.name: Lungs
options.description: The lungs are not primarily affected by hepatitis.

question_name: What is the primary function of red blood cells?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Fight infections
options.description: White blood cells fight infections.

options.name: Transport oxygen
options.description: Red blood cells transport oxygen to the body's tissues.

options.name: Clot blood
options.description: Platelets are responsible for blood clotting.

options.name: Produce hormones
options.description: Endocrine glands produce hormones.

question_name: Which disease is caused by a deficiency of insulin?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Diabetes mellitus
options.description: Diabetes mellitus is caused by a deficiency of insulin.

options.name: Hypothyroidism
options.description: Hypothyroidism is caused by a deficiency of thyroid hormones.

options.name: Addison's disease
options.description: Addison's disease is caused by a deficiency of adrenal hormones.

options.name: Cushing's syndrome
options.description: Cushing's syndrome is caused by excess cortisol.

question_name: What is the normal adult blood pressure range?
subject: Medicine

options.name: 120/80 mmHg
options.description: The normal blood pressure range for adults is around 120/80 mmHg.

options.name: 140/90 mmHg
options.description: This range is considered high blood pressure.

options.name: 100/70 mmHg
options.description: This is on the lower end but still within normal limits.

options.name: 160/100 mmHg
options.description: This range indicates hypertension.

question_name: Which condition is characterized by the inflammation of the joints?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Arthritis
options.description: Arthritis is characterized by the inflammation of the joints.

options.name: Osteoporosis
options.description: Osteoporosis is characterized by weak and brittle bones.

options.name: Fibromyalgia
options.description: Fibromyalgia is characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain.

options.name: Gout
options.description: Gout is a form of arthritis caused by excess uric acid.

question_name: Which organ is responsible for filtering blood and producing urine?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Heart
options.description: The heart pumps blood throughout the body.

options.name: Lungs
options.description: The lungs are responsible for gas exchange.

options.name: Kidneys
options.description: The kidneys filter blood and produce urine.

options.name: Liver
options.description: The liver detoxifies blood and produces bile.

question_name: Which type of blood cell is primarily involved in immune responses?

options.name: Red blood cells
options.description: Red blood cells transport oxygen.

options.name: Platelets
options.description: Platelets are involved in blood clotting.

options.name: White blood cells
options.description: White blood cells are primarily involved in immune responses.

options.name: Plasma cells
options.description: Plasma cells produce antibodies.

question_name: Which condition is characterized by high levels of cortisol?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Addison's disease
options.description: Addison's disease is characterized by low levels of cortisol.

options.name: Cushing's syndrome
options.description: Cushing's syndrome is characterized by high levels of cortisol.

options.name: Graves' disease
options.description: Graves' disease is characterized by high levels of thyroid hormones.

options.name: Hashimoto's thyroiditis
options.description: Hashimoto's thyroiditis is characterized by hypothyroidism.

question_name: Which heart valve is most commonly affected in rheumatic heart disease?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Aortic valve
options.description: The aortic valve is less commonly affected in rheumatic heart disease.

options.name: Mitral valve
options.description: The mitral valve is most commonly affected in rheumatic heart disease.

options.name: Pulmonary valve
options.description: The pulmonary valve is rarely affected in rheumatic heart disease.

options.name: Tricuspid valve
options.description: The tricuspid valve is less commonly affected in rheumatic heart disease.

question_name: What is the primary cause of chronic bronchitis?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Allergic reactions
options.description: Allergic reactions are not the primary cause of chronic bronchitis.

options.name: Smoking
options.description: Smoking is the primary cause of chronic bronchitis.

options.name: Viral infections
options.description: Viral infections can cause acute bronchitis, not chronic bronchitis.

options.name: Bacterial infections
options.description: Bacterial infections are less commonly the primary cause of chronic bronchitis.

question_name: Which condition is diagnosed using the Mantoux test?

options.description: The Mantoux test is used to diagnose tuberculosis.

options.name: HIV/AIDS
options.description: The Mantoux test is not used to diagnose HIV/AIDS.

options.name: Malaria
options.description: The Mantoux test is not used to diagnose malaria.

options.name: Hepatitis
options.description: The Mantoux test is not used to diagnose hepatitis.

question_name: Which electrolyte imbalance is most commonly seen in Addison's disease?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Hyperkalemia
options.description: Hyperkalemia is commonly seen in Addison's disease due to decreased aldosterone.

options.name: Hypokalemia
options.description: Hypokalemia is not commonly seen in Addison's disease.

options.name: Hypernatremia
options.description: Hypernatremia is not commonly seen in Addison's disease.

options.name: Hyponatremia
options.description: Hyponatremia is seen in Addison's disease but less commonly than hyperkalemia.

question_name: Which condition is characterized by episodic chest pain due to coronary artery spasm?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Stable angina
options.description: Stable angina is caused by fixed coronary artery stenosis.

options.name: Unstable angina
options.description: Unstable angina is caused by ruptured atherosclerotic plaque and thrombosis.

options.name: Prinzmetal's angina
options.description: Prinzmetal's angina is characterized by coronary artery spasm.

options.name: Myocardial infarction
options.description: Myocardial infarction is caused by prolonged ischemia leading to heart muscle death.

options.name: Thyroxine

options.name: Parathyroid hormone

options.name: Cortisol
options.description: Cortisol regulates stress response and metabolism.

options.name: Diuretics

options.name: Beta-blockers

options.name: ACE inhibitors

options.name: Calcium channel blockers

options.name: Syphilis

options.name: Vitamin C

options.name: Vitamin D

question_name: Which genetic disorder is characterized by the deletion of the long arm of chromosome 22?

options.name: Turner syndrome

options.name: DiGeorge syndrome

options.name: Klinefelter syndrome
options.description: Klinefelter syndrome is characterized by an extra X chromosome in males.

options.name: Type II hypersensitivity

options.name: Type III hypersensitivity

options.name: Type IV hypersensitivity

question_name: Which type of lung cancer is most strongly associated with smoking?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Adenocarcinoma
options.description: Adenocarcinoma is less strongly associated with smoking compared to other types.

options.name: Small cell lung cancer
options.description: Small cell lung cancer is most strongly associated with smoking.

options.name: Squamous cell carcinoma
options.description: Squamous cell carcinoma is associated with smoking but not as strongly as small cell lung cancer.

options.name: Large cell carcinoma
options.description: Large cell carcinoma has a moderate association with smoking.

options.name: Crohn's disease

options.name: Celiac disease

question_name: Which cardiac marker is most specific for myocardial infarction?
subject: Medicine

options.name: CK-MB
options.description: CK-MB is sensitive but less specific than troponin for myocardial infarction.

options.name: Myoglobin
options.description: Myoglobin rises early but is not specific for myocardial infarction.

options.name: Troponin
options.description: Troponin is the most specific marker for myocardial infarction.

options.name: LDH
options.description: LDH is less specific and rises later than troponin.

options.description: Staphylococcus aureus is not typically associated with peptic ulcer disease.

options.name: Rheumatoid arthritis

options.name: Hypokalemia

question_name: Which disorder is characterized by the progressive loss of dopamine-producing neurons in the substantia nigra?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Alzheimer's disease
options.description: Alzheimer's disease is characterized by the accumulation of amyloid plaques and tau tangles.

options.name: Parkinson's disease
options.description: Parkinson's disease is characterized by the progressive loss of dopamine-producing neurons in the substantia nigra.

options.name: Multiple sclerosis
options.description: Multiple sclerosis is characterized by demyelination of neurons.

options.name: Huntington's disease
options.description: Huntington's disease is characterized by the accumulation of abnormal huntingtin protein.

question_name: Which pathogen is most commonly associated with infectious mononucleosis?

options.name: Cytomegalovirus

options.name: Epstein-Barr virus
options.description: Epstein-Barr virus is most commonly associated with infectious mononucleosis.

options.name: Herpes simplex virus
options.description: Herpes simplex virus is not commonly associated with infectious mononucleosis.

options.name: Human papillomavirus
options.description: Human papillomavirus is not associated with infectious mononucleosis.

question_name: Which neurological disorder is characterized by rapid progressive dementia, myoclonus, and periodic sharp wave complexes on EEG?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease
options.description: Creutzfeldt-Jakob disease (CJD) is characterized by rapid progressive dementia, myoclonus, and periodic sharp wave complexes on EEG.

options.name: Alzheimer's disease
options.description: Alzheimer's disease is characterized by progressive memory loss and cognitive decline.

options.name: Huntington's disease
options.description: Huntington's disease is characterized by progressive motor dysfunction and cognitive decline.

options.name: Parkinson's disease
options.description: Parkinson's disease is characterized by motor symptoms such as tremor and rigidity.

question_name: Which autoimmune disorder primarily affects the peripheral nervous system with ascending muscle weakness?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Myasthenia gravis
options.description: Myasthenia gravis affects neuromuscular junctions but does not typically cause ascending muscle weakness.

options.name: Guillain-Barré syndrome
options.description: Guillain-Barré syndrome primarily affects the peripheral nervous system with ascending muscle weakness.

options.name: Multiple sclerosis
options.description: Multiple sclerosis affects the central nervous system with demyelination of neurons.

options.name: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
options.description: Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis affects motor neurons in the spinal cord and brainstem.

question_name: Which type of cardiomyopathy is characterized by ventricular hypertrophy without dilation?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Dilated cardiomyopathy
options.description: Dilated cardiomyopathy is characterized by ventricular dilation.

options.name: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
options.description: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy is characterized by ventricular hypertrophy without dilation.

options.name: Restrictive cardiomyopathy
options.description: Restrictive cardiomyopathy is characterized by impaired ventricular filling.

options.name: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy
options.description: Arrhythmogenic right ventricular cardiomyopathy is characterized by fibrofatty replacement of myocardium.

question_name: Which syndrome is characterized by the triad of hypothyroidism, adrenal insufficiency, and ovarian failure?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Turner syndrome
options.description: Turner syndrome involves ovarian failure but not hypothyroidism or adrenal insufficiency.

options.name: Cushing's syndrome
options.description: Cushing's syndrome involves adrenal hyperfunction, not adrenal insufficiency.

options.name: Polyglandular autoimmune syndrome type II
options.description: Polyglandular autoimmune syndrome type II is characterized by the triad of hypothyroidism, adrenal insufficiency, and ovarian failure.

options.name: Klinefelter syndrome
options.description: Klinefelter syndrome involves testicular failure, not ovarian failure.

question_name: Which type of renal stone is most likely to form in patients with chronic metabolic acidosis?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Calcium oxalate
options.description: Calcium oxalate stones are associated with hypercalciuria and hyperoxaluria.

options.name: Uric acid
options.description: Uric acid stones are more likely to form in patients with chronic metabolic acidosis.

options.name: Struvite
options.description: Struvite stones are associated with urinary tract infections.

options.name: Cystine
options.description: Cystine stones are associated with cystinuria, a genetic disorder.

question_name: Which infectious disease is characterized by a biphasic fever pattern and a rash that begins on the wrists and ankles?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Typhoid fever
options.description: Typhoid fever has a prolonged fever and a different rash pattern.

options.name: Rocky Mountain spotted fever
options.description: Rocky Mountain spotted fever is characterized by a biphasic fever pattern and a rash that begins on the wrists and ankles.

options.name: Dengue fever
options.description: Dengue fever has a different rash pattern and fever course.

options.name: Measles
options.description: Measles has a distinct rash pattern and fever course.

question_name: Which vasculitis is most commonly associated with hepatitis B virus infection?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Giant cell arteritis
options.description: Giant cell arteritis is not associated with hepatitis B virus infection.

options.name: Polyarteritis nodosa
options.description: Polyarteritis nodosa is most commonly associated with hepatitis B virus infection.

options.name: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis
options.description: Granulomatosis with polyangiitis (Wegener's) is associated with ANCA antibodies.

options.name: Kawasaki disease
options.description: Kawasaki disease primarily affects children and has an unknown etiology.

question_name: Which endocrine disorder is characterized by hypersecretion of cortisol from an adrenal adenoma?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Cushing's disease
options.description: Cushing's disease involves hypersecretion of ACTH from the pituitary gland.

options.name: Pheochromocytoma
options.description: Pheochromocytoma involves hypersecretion of catecholamines from the adrenal medulla.

options.name: Adrenal hyperplasia
options.description: Adrenal hyperplasia involves bilateral hyperplasia of the adrenal glands.

options.name: Adrenal adenoma
options.description: Adrenal adenoma causes hypersecretion of cortisol, leading to Cushing's syndrome.

question_name: Which type of shock is characterized by high cardiac output and low systemic vascular resistance?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Hypovolemic shock
options.description: Hypovolemic shock is characterized by low cardiac output and high systemic vascular resistance.

options.name: Cardiogenic shock
options.description: Cardiogenic shock is characterized by low cardiac output and high systemic vascular resistance.

options.name: Distributive shock
options.description: Distributive shock (e.g., septic shock) is characterized by high cardiac output and low systemic vascular resistance.

options.name: Obstructive shock
options.description: Obstructive shock is characterized by mechanical obstruction to blood flow.

question_name: Which malignancy is most commonly associated with a paraneoplastic syndrome involving Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome?
subject: Medicine

options.name: Small cell lung cancer
options.description: Small cell lung cancer is most commonly associated with Lambert-Eaton myasthenic syndrome (LEMS) as a paraneoplastic syndrome.

options.name: Non-small cell lung cancer
options.description: Non-small cell lung cancer is less commonly associated with LEMS.

options.name: Breast cancer
options.description: Breast cancer is not typically associated with LEMS.

options.name: Pancreatic cancer
options.description: Pancreatic cancer can have various paraneoplastic syndromes, but not commonly LEMS.
